children.value:
is used to present a defined list of options for the user
to choose from.

<Playground>
  <Select placeholder="My best friend">
    <Option value="tony">Tony</Option>
    <Option value="quincy">Quincy</Option>
    <Option value="peppa">Peppa Pig</Option>
  </Select>
</Playground>

<Playground>
  <Select size="small">
    <Option value="">Small</Option>
    <Option value="sad" disabled>
      Tony
    </Option>
    <Option value="old">Steve</Option>
    <Option value="splat">Natasha</Option>
  </Select>
</Playground>

<Playground>
  <Select size="large">
    <Option value="">Small</Option>
    <Option value="sad" disabled>
      Tony
    </Option>
    <Option value="old">Steve</Option>
    <Option value="splat">Natasha</Option>
  </Select>
</Playground>
defines a value selectable by a
